Reviews.Title: “very clean room”
Reviews.Author: chocolabrador f
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, very small single room, cleaned every day. Good breakfast. Tv only french channels

Reviews.Title: “Jekyll and hyde”
Reviews.Author: batikmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in 4 days. Because we were trying to travel on a budget, but still have a bath and internet, we knew there would be compromises, but... Our first room was small but seriously not well kept. It looked like it needed paint and carpet and some repairs. it felt dingy. The second time the room was comparably small but had clearly received some attention so who knows? I have to say the staff were helpful when we had a jam and needed to leave bags for a few hours. It is very handy to Gare du Nord and if you don't mind a few blocks walk there's a wonderful area with food from Turkey to India.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a couple of areas need improving”
Reviews.Author: emzy_wemzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for two nights. The hotel is very close to Gare Du Nord station and Poissoniere metro station so although a little out of the centre, it has good connections to the main tourist attractions. Our room was basic, but clean and tidy and a good size overall. Breakfast was good, with lots of choice. A couple of negatives - no tea or coffee making facilities in the room (we even asked at reception when we returned one day if we could buy a coffee from reception and were told no). Also the hairdryer in the room was not very powerful so girls, if it takes ages to dry your hair generally, its probably best to bring your own! The main disappointment was the situation we had with the safety deposit box. There wasn't one in our room so we asked at reception and they advised they had a safe box in reception we could use. We had a small "boot bag" sized bag with some items in that we put in the safe on our first day. We took the bag back to our room on the first night and on the second morning, went to return it to the safe but were told it was too big for the safe despite having it in there the day before! Bizarre. That night, before going out for the evening, we stopped at reception so that we could get some money and were told that the key was not available to the safe and that we would be able to get access the next morning! This really was not very helpful as my boyfriend and I had to then go out for the evening with very little money between us as we had put most of it in the safe! I would have rated the hotel 4 out of 5 had it not been for this issue.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Edouard D
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days there with my girlfriend to visit Paris and it was definitely a good choice. Hostel is very modern and clean and the staff is always available. The room was not that big but confortable and beautiful. Central location. Don't miss the breakfast. We'll come back as soon as possible : )

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Secret”
Reviews.Author: Camille W
Reviews.Content: Ever since I have started to travel frequently from for work to Paris, I stay here. Extremely well located, tucked in a quite street, it is easy to get here from train stations, RER or walk to Galerie Lafayette. The employees are very amicable and helpful. Rooms are always fresh and clean. Breakfast in the winter garden - nicely decorated with plants, and flowers - quite rare to find in a hotel of this calibar in Paris! - is aplenty. I recommend staying here in a beat!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased by comfort lafayette!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid D
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel! The rooms were clean, big enough (bathroom was even bigger than we had expected for the price we paid, and had a bath including shower, which we enjoyed very much), and the bed was very comfortable! The flat screen TV worked perfectly. Clean towels every day (if you wanted, we like to use them several times cause of the environment) and they clean up and make your bed every day as well. We booked a 5 day trip to Paris and this hotel made it a defenite success! The breakfastbuffet was amazing, with croissants, pain de chocolat, cereal, juices, breadrolls, egg, etc etc. The people who worked at the hotel were very nice and helpful, and can speak good english. Never it was a burden to help us out or to arrange anything! Great!!! Location is AMAZING: only around the corner from the metro stop 'poissonière' which gets you around paris in no time! We were very surprised by the metro system and how easy it is to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young tourists”
Reviews.Author: Lamota
Reviews.Content: Great location, its only few minutes walk to a metro station and about 10 minutes walk to the central train station (gure du nord). there are many shops and restaurants within walking distance. The staff was very friendly, always with a smile, and fluent in English. The room (i got one on the third floor) was small but clean and comfy, with phone, lcd tv and dryer. it was perfect for us, who left in the morning and came back at night. the breakfast was very good - cereal, eggs, fresh bread, fruits, juices and of course fresh cruason :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay , if you are sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Vidya G
Reviews.Content: We had stayed for 9 days. Very difficult to find a better located hotel, for this price. The Metro is just 3 minutes walk. Rue de Lafayette is 3 minutes walk. Any direction you walk, there are lots and lots of restaurants. The location of the hotel makes it easy for you to walk and see the places around. We had walked all the way to Arc de triuphe and on another day to the Notre dam. The hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly and speak good English. The breakfast spread is good, may be the best you will find in any hotel who charges the same. But it is the same everyday, and since we stayed for 9 days, we found it a little boring towards the end. The only negative thing I can say is that the whole place is very small. Lobby is small, lift is supersmall, rooms are small and the showers, the smallest of them all! But everything is sparkling clean. By the end of the 3rd day, I had learned to stand so still and take a shower without a droplet coming out of the shower curtain! There are also slightly larger room with larger bathrooms with a tub ( my sis in law got such a room). All in all, great value for money especially if you are going to roam outside the whole day , and come back and just sleep through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: haksent
Reviews.Content: PROS : Very good location - less than 100m to metro, about 10min walk to Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est. Very clean - room carpet, toilet, bath, you name it.. Hair dryer is a plus. Good breakfast. Nice staff that speaks english. CONS : - No cupboards, hanger , etc. I was almost shocked to see there's no place to hang my suit.. Overall very good value for your money especially if you're not a business traveler with suits to hang...

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel to enjoy holidays in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Marialuisia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located (good restaurants and shops, near access to train and subway stations) . The rooms are very charming (pretty and modern furniture with colorful flowers)) and thank god, the cleanness is perfect! They are very comfortable and relaxing. By the way, as a foreign tourist, i was happily surprised by the friendly welcoming of the staff there . They are very careful of your well - being in the hotel and they do their best to make your stay here as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. By the way, they also perfectly speak English and Spanish which isn't the case in all Parisian hotels and last but not least they serve a great and tasteful typical French breakfast, their croissants are yummy!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie43_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 1 night only. all in all it was great value for money. The breakfasts are exceptionally good. since we were 3 in our party, we had a air conditioned spacious loft apartment, which was very nice, with a lounge, kitchenette ( no kettle but stocked with crockery and cutlery), bathroom ( no bath only shower with shower curtain that was a bit too small - so water went everywhere) and a single bed. Upstairs there was a cupboard and a double bed. the beds were very comfy. my only complaint was the lack of kettle ( but there was a microwave), the shower curtain and NO ELEVATOR ON THIS WING . if you are a couple ask for the wing with the elevator ( those rooms do have a proper shower door). The hotel is also conveniently located about a 100m from the Poisonneire station, 1 stop away from Gare du l'est.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gumbo4
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for just 1 night at the end of June 2011 and were extremely pleased with this hotel. Conveniently located less than 1 minute walk away from the Metro down a quiet street but with plenty of shops, supermarkets and eating places within a couple of minutes walk. The staff were very polite and friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. When we arrived the temperature in Paris was 35 degrees so we were very glad of the air conditioning in the room! Breakfast was also good - even though we arrived for it right at the end of the allocated Breakfast time the staff were still replenishing the food so we had the same choice as if we'd have come down to eat at 7.00am! Overall a really good hotel and a great base to explore Paris for a couple of nights. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just about ok”
Reviews.Author: centraltraveller
Reviews.Content: A small budget hotel not far from the centre of Paris and the Gare Du Nord. Rooms were small and felt cramped, and the bathroom basic, with only a cheap plastic shower curtain. The room was just about ok, although the room cleanliness was poor, with grey-black dust in places and a worn feel to furnishings. Hotel staff were just about ok, efficient but not overly helpful. Would we go back? Not if we could find another hotel in the area for the same price. Plus points were the nearness of metro stations and shops. Some hotels make a holiday, this hotel is one that was only a place to sleep, nothing more. So if you plan on spending lots of time in the hotel or room, then this is not the place for you. The hotel is just about ok, and probably gets a 5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money value”
Reviews.Author: AlexandrP
Reviews.Content: Quite a good hotel for reasonable price. Value for money as they say. The location is close enouth to boulevards and Monmartr neighborhood. The only thing I don't like in my room is the curtain rod as I could not open the window widely.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would opt for a place with better value for money next time”
Reviews.Author: janbrubel
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel scores good. At 155 Euro a night i did expect something more though. + Good staff Nice breakfast Good beds Fairly clean Very good location Free wifi and newspaper - Rooms could use a few touches of paint Carpet throughout (smell) Small shower Sober room The place has all the basic comfort and a quality service. It felt like a sleep only place to me, mainly because the rooms are fairly small and very sober. At 155 a night (breakfast included) it might be a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE MONEY STOLEN”
Reviews.Author: Traveller00uk
Reviews.Content: Do not stay this hotel. Money was stolen while were out for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rolltideinn
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, on a quite sidestreet. Rooms are small, bed was comfortable. Very helpful staff, they arranged a Seine River dinner cruise at a discounted rate. It was the highlight of our five days there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a quiet and central location...”
Reviews.Author: SureOslo
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip to Paris with the children (9 years old twins) but were very late in making a reservation. So we ended up booking the Comfort Hotel La Fayette the night before we arrived. The reason for choosing this hotel was the price, the location and that it stated in the text and pictures that it was newly renovated. We didn't have any expectations of this being a good hotel - since we weren't going to stay much at the hotel anyway. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and nice. Breakfast was continental - not huge - but more than enough for us. The staff were friendly - and the parrot / birds were an extra added value for the children. The location were ideal - quiet and only a minute to walk to the Metro. As mentioned above, we did not have high expections. But we got more than expected. This is not a luxury hotel - but a comfortable bed & breakfast hotel. You get what you pay for - and this time I felt I received more than I expected... PS - the rooms are not large enough for a family of 4 - but we decided to book two rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: steveinns
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many inner city hotels across Europe over the years, the small room was not unexpected. Being in Paris, you really only need a room to store your stuff, shower and sleep. This being said, the room and hotel in general was spotless. The breakfast buffet was well stocked as well - great coffee. The hotel staff were superb. The front desk personnel were always very polite, friendly and were a great help in making reservations and providing sundry information. The location is great, only about 100m from the Poissonierre Metro station and 500m from the Gare du Nord. The neighbourhood is full of small brasseries, bakeries and shops and is about a 10 minute walk from a large pedestrian area near the Seine and 20-30 minutes from the Louvre and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “A very wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Freexone2
Reviews.Content: After reading former reviews, I wasn't expecting too much. But I was really surprised to find this hotel extremely well-serviced and very accommodating. I encountered 4 staff members during my stay. While one was an absolute grouch, the other three well made up for their slacking counterpart. They answered all my questions and really seemed concerned about making my stay a good one. The room was very clean, new, and modern. Yes, it would be a bit cramped for two, but for just me, I was fine. My one complaint would be the shower...it's pretty tiny and the curtain tends to stick to you...not so fun. But the street is quiet and VERY close to the metro stop. As a young woman traveling on her own and concerned with safety, I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended/ will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: blackstar500
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in paris. We orignal booked to stay at the Villa staint Martin but was advised that some member had extended their stay. So we ended up at comfort hotel la fayette which they claim is part of the group although i was very suspious to my suprise i must admit the hotel was brilliant. Please note i have stayed in many hotels even in England i give top marks to this hotel. Very helpful staff, they spoke english, were able to advice us to what to do in paris, i believe the hotel was recently renovated, rooms were very clean expect that the shower space was tiny, free wireless, flat screen tv not that you would understand the language, the buffet is well packed - very close to the metro and central to all the tourist destinations. I definately go back again

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer services”
Reviews.Author: Jammm
Reviews.Content: Please if I could stop one person from staying here I have done my job. The hotel staff is extremely rude except one clerk. Items were stolen from my room. When I reported this to corporate they had the manager repond to my inquiry on the stolen items. In his response he tried to state that we stayed in our room all day and nobody entered to clean it. PLEASE we were in PAris who stays in a comfort Suites room all day when your in PARIS!! So he lied about that since some one had cleaned it and our items were gone. I guess we should be lucky our room was even cleaned the hotel hallways were filthy empty bottles and used towels. It was the most horrible hotel in our 2 week tour of Europe.. There are better hotels in the area for the same price!! PLEASE do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Belongings!”
Reviews.Author: jandgbl1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Reservation tells you 12 p.m. We checked in at 3 p.m. and were told that our room "might" be ready. After waiting in the lobby for 15 minutes listening to a parrot we were allowed to enter our room. When we entered the hallway it was filled with empty bottles and used towels. Made the hallway smell like a gym locker room. Got into our room and it was small. Shower is super small. Just a stall about 3ft wide and the curtain when wet sticks to your body. We registered for only two days left after one. Reason is because they had stolen some of our toiletries and other items out our bag. Items all together about $50 bucks. When we went down to complain we were told it was our fault for leaving the stuff out. They also tried to blame us for breaking there spam ridden computer. Which on this day everyone was using because Paris decided to go on Strike. We tried to explain ourselves about how his computer was downloading someone else’s adware and they did not care because some other Parisian saw us do this to the computer, when we were looking for how to use our eurostar tickets to get out of paris since the city shut down. We than told them about how we tried to fix it because we work on computers for a living and he did not care. We told the manager that this was not the case and he did not care. So we grabbed our stuff and checked out. Decided to check into another Spectacular hotel near the Opera house. Hotel Opera (we left a review of this hotel as well since we were 10x please with how we were treated and the luxuries that come with this hotel.) Overall, the owner and his employee were rude and did not care about our belongings. They like to blame Americans for there problems and they steal. If someone takes toiletries and other items that we left out who is to say what else they have taken. We used tripadvisor for our trip and this was the only hotel that I do not recommend because I went off of one review. You pay for what you get and we got screwed. Overall I would not recommend this hotel or its staff. Not because how we were treated but because for 20-30 euro more you get a better place in a nicer neighborhood. If you stay here just be weary of your belongings and dont touch the computer.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Hotel Paris La Fayette
HotelInfo.Address: 23 rue des Messageries | 10th Arr., 75010 Paris, France
